meanings.definition: To persuade someone to believe something again.
meanings.sent1: After showing her the evidence, he managed to reconvince her of his innocence.
meanings.sent2: She tried to reconvince her friend that ghosts were not real by explaining the science behind it.
meanings.sent3: The magician had to reconvince the audience that his disappearing act was not real magic.
meanings.sent4: The teacher's passion for the subject was so strong that she could reconvince even the most skeptical students.
meanings.sent5: The heartfelt apology helped reconvince him of her sincerity.

meanings.definition: To make someone feel certain about something again.
meanings.sent1: The success of the project helped reconvince the team of their abilities.
meanings.sent2: The comforting words from her friend reconvince her that everything would be okay.
meanings.sent3: The familiar smell of her favorite dish reconvince her of her decision to order it.
meanings.sent4: The beautiful sunset over the ocean reconvince him of the beauty of nature.
meanings.sent5: The supportive messages from her family reconvince her of their love and care.
